Info.Name: Balsamine
Info.Content: The Festival of World Cultures (9th edition) is the daily enjoy for music and cultures in summer times in the city of Nantes, France, with more than 35 shows and 100 artists from around the world. The most creative world music shows, both contemporary ones and traditional ones, will be given at public places, outdoor cinemas and even some famous natural spots. Since the summer times of 2005, the Festival of World Cultures has made its thread, creed and commitments. It presents performances on the basis of exchanging between artists from both local and abroad. And it promotes cultural conversations and appointments between men and women, which help to push through their boundaries and to interact with each other. The festival presents things from all over the world!

Info.Name: Anthericum
Info.Content: Anick Martin, accordionist Nantes, fabulous extremely inventive instrumentalist in what he calls a traditional Breton music postage. Both continue an amazing energy and freedom that they have in common is revealed forcefully dialogue to support the tradition, for a klezmer, Breton for another, and the plunge into an open multiple influences and news horizons. A perfect opportunity East-West confrontation

Info.Name: Clematite
Info.Content: From a repertoire of songs that intersect in an imaginary language, improvisation, games resonance between voice, winds and percussion, Mathilde Lechat and musicians compose a glittering and elegant universe fed both singing of North India, early music, jazz, dance and theater

Info.Name: Amaranthe
Info.Content: The History of Tango will be the basis of the complicity of the two Nantes which then enrich their repertoire of classical pieces by Gabriel Faure, Erik Satie or Bela Bartok to create a melancholy duet

Info.Name: Camellia
Info.Content: two carriers of ancestral instrumental repertoire that could keep them away from each other: the setar (lute) traditionally plays the ney (flute), the kaval (flute) with tapan (drum) music Iranian classic is learned while the original directory flutes kaval is popular

Info.Name: Myrobalan
Info.Content: Base to make this adventure in any intoxicating melodies, simplicity and humanity

Info.Name: Coquelourde
Info.Content: Classical, Oriental influences, particularly Lebanese, pop, minimal electro, Bachar Mar-Khalife captivates the intensity of his voice, his percussion work and ideas. Kurdish song that expresses the pain of exile and the hope of a country, he delivers an intimate concert and engaged

Info.Name: Noisettier
Info.Content: With their instrumental funk crossbred Afrobeat, Malinke Guinean Brazilian Candomble, samba and cumbia, Bixiga 70 (Bixiga is the name of their cosmopolitan) is one of the most popular groups of all Sao Paulo. Real scenic bomb, big rising star thriving scene Afrobeat, the group adds drums, dub, guitar Mandingo and occurs for the first time in France this summer

Info.Name: Ornithogale
Info.Content: Musician without borders whose identity is both fickle and firmly rooted in its Turkish roots, The Fakir mocks labels! Machines and Turkish clarinet electrified disseminate a free and creative music, ranging from sweet madness and genius inspiration

Info.Name: Grenadier
Info.Content: Guitarist Serge Teyssot-Gay (Black Desire) and oud player Khaled Al Jaramani met in Damascus, Syria, Khaled countries in 2002. Immediate meeting where everyone knew immediately let the other play and make way for his instrument. After two albums, the third day captivates creating a contemplative atmosphere, sensual and mysterious. In this extended version, percussionist Keyvan Chemirani clarinetist Carol Robinson and trumpeter Andreas Polyzogopoulos join the duo on stage. This waiting for spring is not simply a Franco-Syrian dialogue twinning but in Interzone living, inhabited and free

Info.Name: Pervenche
Info.Content: Creative meeting talented Emilie Lesbros (view from Barre Philips) Rafaëlle Rinaudo (in String of Consciousness) and Julia Kent (Antony and the Johnsons) in Single Room begins a journey through sound, twisting harmonies and alloy words, a journey where violence becomes poetry

Info.Name: Jusquiame
Info.Content: Musician's flagship jazz and improvised music in Europe, the cellist Vincent Courtois met the poet, storyteller and singer Andre Cameroonian origin Ze Afane Jam in 2000 and began with him a series of creations. This last step, the Fisher King is a fruitful dialogue between the lyric and music pre-cise cellist and poetic words and activists storyteller. Of deforestation in the arrest of Patrice Lumumba, Ze infuses humor with strong messages without moralism, through a pictorial writing. A musical bridge between Africa and France that combines electrical and western chamber rock with joyful rhythms

Info.Name: Immortelle
Info.Content: The Burgundian accordionist Christian Maes and player qanun (Arab zither) Jordanian Halim Al Khatib are joined by percussionist cosmopolitan Etienne Gruel to create this Trio Safar (Travel in Arabic) and reinforce a unique union between the qanun and accordion to the point that it seems here to become an instrument of oriental music

Info.Name: Eglantine
Info.Content: Along the route of the Gypsies, there Louis Winsberg, guitarist of the legendary jazz-rock Sixun bathed in tiny gypsy culture and Renaud Garcia-Fons, bassist known for his immense virtuosity, his Mediterranean melodic sense and his s 'approaching that of a violin. These two virtuoso jazz and flamenco fetched in the Maghreb and the Balkans friendly interbreeding traditions. On this journey, they crossed Prabhu Edouard, nomadic tabla and passionate experimenter, collaborator personalities such as Jordi Savall and Nguyen Lê. A trio of high-profile to track a wandering stamped musical road

Info.Name: Angelique
Info.Content: With her cello, nomadic Eugenie Ursch touches the stars and the moon sings! In a poetic journey that goes from the Maghreb to the Balkans, which includes Russian traditional tunes, Turkish, Bulgarian, Berber or Kabyle songs, texts by Mallarme, Maeterlinck, Ana Garcia Lorca or Tot, she marries his voice cello. Thousand voices then guide us through his journey as a mystical presence

Info.Name: Genevrier
Info.Content: Student at the highly acclaimed oud player Naseer Shamma, all young Egyptian Mohamed prodigy Abozekry never tired of dragging his instrument and his impeccable classical training to unusual countries. After meeting with the gypsy guitarist William Hogan, training Heejaz also associated AnneLaure Bourget, percussionist Hugo Reydet cosmopolitan, free jazz bassist, this search for a new musical path. Duo came in the 2011 edition of In the Summer hours Heejaz returns to full training at the time of the release of his first album which finds its source in the events that followed the Jasmine Revolution in Egypt

Info.Name: Jonquille
Info.Content: Outdoor exhibits fell to nights in the city park

Info.Name: Groseiller
Info.Content: On an island in the Venetian lagoon, a fisherman, Bepi, made the acquaintance of a young Chinese immigrant recently, Shun Li, who works as a bartender. A sweet friendship develops between them gradually while yet everything seems to separate them. But their feelings disturb two communities that reject: Italians and Chinese see a dim view of their growing complicity ... Between realism and poetry, the director here revives the great tradition of storytelling in Italian

Info.Name: Colchique
Info.Content: On an island in the Venetian lagoon, a fisherman, Bepi, made the acquaintance of a young Chinese immigrant recently, Shun Li, who works as a bartender. A sweet friendship develops between them gradually while yet everything seems to separate them. But their feelings disturb two communities that reject: Italians and Chinese see a dim view of their growing complicity ... Between realism and poetry, the director here revives the great tradition of storytelling in Italian

Info.Name: Mandragore
Info.Content: Young illegal immigrant, Elias crossed the Mediterranean and Italy and France to win Paris, city of which he had long dreamed. Tragicomic journey and highly personal film for Costa Gavras who left Greece for Paris there are more than fifty years, Eden Is West takes the point of view of the immigrant in a crowded road movie dating more or less appropriate to sign a film on universal

Info.Name: Coriandre
Info.Content: Bob Harris (Bill Murray), actor on the decline, goes to Tokyo to shoot a commercial. At the same luxury, Charlotte (Scarlett Johansson), a young American just graduated, accompanies her husband, fashion photographer. Isolated in this gigantic city that is unknown to them, Bob and Charlotte firmly bored. Their meeting is open to the world around them, a Japan as a traditional and whimsical turn their trip into a tender and poetic quest

Info.Name: Asphodele
Info.Content: In the early twentieth century, a family of Sicilian peasants toils on the same plot of land for generations. She leads a life in harmony with nature with a certain monotony occasionally interrupted by the stories of the New World. Tempted by the Eldorado, Salvatore decided to sell everything and from the other side of the ocean. But to become a citizen of the New World, we must abandon the age-old traditions and the old beliefs of his land, know how to obey and swear loyalty if you want to cross The Golden Gate

Info.Name: Hepatique
Info.Content: On the death of his father, the young Parisian Stephane (Romain Duris) through Romania in search of a singer that his father never stopped listening, Nora Luca. His research will lead him into a Roma village where he will befriend Izidore and be gradually accepted by the people although a Gadjo dilo (crazy foreigner). He then discovers the Roma culture and meeting Sabina, sensual and wild. An initiatory quest that takes us to the heart of Gypsy culture

Info.Name: Capillaire
Info.Content: Iconic movie musicals of the golden age of Hollywood, An American in Paris following the footsteps of Jerry Mulligan (Gene Kelly), American artist and painter living in Montmartre who falls madly in love with a girl promised to another. Criss-crossed lovers, the film evokes a Paris dream and ends with a masterful ballet to the music of Gershwin. Kitscherie between lyricism and a classic outdoor revie

Info.Name: Amaryllis
Info.Content: Shows early childhood school from six years to the youth of the university find the program of activities for children in cultural centers and theaters in Nantes: clown, magician, puppet and other activities for children

Info.Name: Menyauthe
Info.Content: When a guitarist, Beatrice Morisco-Reuther (First Prize of the Paris Conservatoire in the class of Alexander Lagoya) and a specialist in classical and body percussion Stephane Grosjean meet, it is an explosion of undulating rhythms, Iberian and Latin that s ad! At the fingertips of these two virtuosos take life environments of South America. Fantasies and other extravagances musicians bind the sweet melodies of bossa nova and sow joy, warmth and sun of Brazil

Info.Name: Chataignier
Info.Content: The earth is cracked, it is the desert and the world is dying. A little boy, Selim had a strange dream: a faceless woman told him that water is trapped somewhere underground and it is up to him to deliver. The story swings between music, sounds and songs. Traditional instruments meet the objects of all kinds, became melodious. The voice of Matilda Lechat, bold, fed lyrical songs and songs of North India charms us, we mesmerizes and takes us on a journey with Selim

Info.Name: Hyacinthe
Info.Content: The earth is cracked, it is the desert and the world is dying. A little boy, Selim had a strange dream: a faceless woman told him that water is trapped somewhere underground and it is up to him to deliver. The story swings between music, sounds and songs. Traditional instruments meet the objects of all kinds, became melodious. The voice of Matilda Lechat, bold, fed lyrical songs and songs of North India charms us, we mesmerizes and takes us on a journey with Selim

Info.Name: Framboise
Info.Content: Received the next day concert adult, cellist Vincent Courtois and storyteller Andre Ze Jam Afane here to play small. The texts tell of the discovery of the world by falsely ingenuous eyes Cameroonian poet who breathes strong and profound messages through a specific African culture pictorial writing. A tender and delicate tale that Ze Jam where ancient tradition meets Cameroon joyful melodies and strained one of the most creative musicians of jazz rhythms hexagonal history

Info.Name: Momordique
Info.Content: Eager young musician adventures, Mehmet left his native Turkey and from the paths of the Silk Road in the hope of finding inspiration. Across Iran, Afghanistan, India and the Taklamakan desert, the boy learns to become an artist and an accomplished man. Daughter of musician and composer Titi Robin, Robin Maria sing and dance forever with a communicative generosity. She is accompanied by Shadi Fathi, brilliant classical soloist Iranian who excels in all stringed instruments in the percussion

Info.Name: Gnaphales
Info.Content: Very loosely inspired by a story that the great Brazilian writer Jorge Amado wrote to his son, the story of awkward Chat and Demoiselle Swallow portrays a red and black striped cat, boor, rude, foul-mouthed, awkward, unloved and a Demoiselle Hirondelle which all birds are lovers of Bahia

Info.Name: Giroflees
Info.Content: There are more than 500 years, beyond the ocean, lived the Indian chief Tupac Amaru who blackmailed the wind through his flutes. Came the Spaniard Juan Jose Perez Gonzalez landed with his guitar to discover the New World and Fatoumata Kouyate African uprooted which sing its channels in the cotton fields. All three meet, mingle their songs and giving rise to new rhythms and new music

Info.Name: Digitales
Info.Content: Actors turn the pages of a novel, a story or a collection of poems. We see, we hear, we touch and taste it too ... Our senses are the honor of this trip in literature

Info.Name: Fraxinelle
Info.Content: The sound of the wind in the trees, the smell of the woods, the heat of the sand, sun glare, the salty taste of the sea, it is a sensory nature reveals Yannick Hachet young promising student drama class at the Conservatoire National de Region de Nantes

Info.Name: Plaqueminier
Info.Content: Comedian Angevin, Dominique Huet has chosen to focus her practice on the book. The Jardin des Plantes, he caresses, sniffs, hears, tastes and observe nature to awaken our senses

Info.Name: Pissenlits
Info.Content: Comedian Angevin, Dominique Huet has chosen to focus her practice on the book. The Jardin des Plantes, he caresses, sniffs, hears, tastes and observe nature to awaken our senses

Info.Name: Marguerite
Info.Content: Actress Nantes since 1990, Claudine Bonhomme indulges his feelings to describe nature in its perceptible noises and sounds in its shapes and colors, in its scents and perfumes, in its sweetness and flavor

Info.Name: Bourrache
Info.Content: Sight, smell, hearing, taste and touch all our senses are awakened in nature. Sophie Renou, actress of the Faithful idea, it also seeks to expand its 6th sense

Info.Name: Cornouiller
Info.Content: Founder of Theatre Reflection, Eric Ferrat uses his nose, his eyes, his ears, his tongue and hands to play a character in every sense
